Title:
Description of Reddellomyces acaciae sp. nov. a new truffle
species sampled beneath Acacia saligna Labill
Keywords:
Acacia saligna (Labill.), Mediterranean-type climate,
Molecular phylogeny, Morphology, Reddellomces acaciae.
Abstract:
Specimens of a new truffle were collected from Acacia
saligna stands in Tunisian semi arid lands. The fruitbodies show white
to cream ascomata with chambered gleba (solid ptychothecium), ornamented
ascospores and cylindrical paraphyses. Based on these morphological
features, the fungus seems closely related to Reddellomyces
parvulosporus, R. westraliensis and R. donkii excepting the dimension of
its ascospores. Molecular analysis based on the nuclear large ribosomal
subunit (28S rDNA) and nuc rDNA ITS1-5.8S-ITS2 (ITS barcode) and
sequences confirm its affiliation to the genus Reddellomyces.
Combination of molecular data and morphological characteristics of these
organisms warrants designation of a novel species within the genus
Reddellomyces.
